skill.name: data-privacy-compliance
skill.description: Data privacy and regulatory compliance specialist for GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA, and international data protection laws. Use when implementing privacy controls, conducting data protection impact assessments, ensuring regulatory compliance, or managing data subject rights. Expert in consent management, data minimization, and privacy-by-design principles.
skill.summary: Data privacy and regulatory compliance specialist for GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA, and international data protection laws.
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Static scanner flagged multiple patterns in documentation including cryptographic references, command execution keywords, and credential access terms. All findings are FALSE POSITIVES - the skill is a compliance documentation tool that discusses privacy concepts in prose. The SKILL.md file contains educational content about GDPR, CCPA, and HIPAA compliance requirements. No actual dangerous code patterns exist.

content.value_statement: Organizations struggle to navigate complex data protection regulations. This skill provides expert guidance on GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA, and international privacy laws to help you implement compliant data practices.
actual_capabilities: Generate GDPR compliance checklists and documentation templates
Create CCPA consumer rights response templates and processes
Develop HIPAA security safeguard documentation and policies
Draft privacy policy clauses aligned with international regulations
Create data processing agreement templates and audit trails
Generate privacy impact assessment frameworks and reports
limitations: Does not provide legal advice or replace counsel from licensed attorneys
Cannot execute compliance checks on live systems or databases
Does not generate technical implementations of security controls
Cannot validate compliance status without human review of outputs

use_cases.title: Create GDPR Compliance Documentation
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive GDPR compliance materials including data processing records, consent forms, and data subject rights procedures.
use_cases.target_user: Compliance officers and data protection professionals

use_cases.title: Draft Privacy Policies and Notices
use_cases.description: Create clear privacy policies and notices that meet requirements across multiple jurisdictions including CCPA, GDPR, and HIPAA.

use_cases.title: Develop Privacy Impact Assessments
use_cases.description: Build structured privacy impact assessment templates to evaluate data processing activities and identify compliance gaps.

prompt_templates.title: Basic GDPR Compliance Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GDPR compliance checklist for a company that collects customer email addresses for marketing purposes. Include requirements for consent, data storage limits, and data subject rights.

prompt_templates.title: CCPA Consumer Rights Response
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a response template for CCPA consumer requests including the right to know, right to delete, and right to opt-out of sale.

prompt_templates.title: HIPAA Safeguards Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate documentation for HIPAA technical safeguards including access controls, audit controls, and transmission security requirements.

prompt_templates.title: International Data Transfer Agreement
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a data processing agreement template that includes Standard Contractual Clauses for international data transfers under GDPR Article 46.

output_examples.input: Create a GDPR Article 13 transparency notice template for an e-commerce website
output: - Company name, address, and contact details
- List of processing purposes (order fulfillment, marketing, analytics)
- Legal basis for each processing activity (consent, contract, legitimate interest)
- Marketing consent: 3 years from last interaction
- Account data: Until account deletion request
- Right to access, rectification, erasure, portability
- Right to lodge a complaint with supervisory authority

output_examples.input: Draft a CCPA do-not-sell notice for website footer
output: DO NOT SELL MY PERSONAL INFORMATION
California residents have the right to opt-out of the sale of their personal information.
We do not sell personal information of consumers we actually know are under 16 years of age.

best_practices: Always have legal counsel review final compliance documentation before implementation
Maintain version control for compliance documents to track changes over time
Update privacy documentation whenever data processing activities change
anti_patterns: Do not use this skill to generate compliance certifications without human expert review
Do not rely solely on generated templates without adapting to your specific context
Do not treat generated compliance documents as legal advice or binding opinions

faq.question: Does this skill replace a privacy officer or legal counsel?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides documentation templates and guidance based on privacy regulations. Always have qualified legal counsel review compliance materials for your specific situation.

faq.question: Which regulations does this skill cover?
faq.answer: The skill covers GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA, LGPD, PIPEDA, and general international data protection principles. Coverage focuses on major jurisdictions with some variation in depth.

faq.question: Can this skill validate my actual compliance status?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates documentation frameworks and templates. Actual compliance validation requires legal review, technical audits, and human assessment of your specific practices.

faq.question: How often should I update compliance documentation?
faq.answer: Review and update privacy documentation at least annually, or whenever there are significant changes to data processing activities, regulations, or business operations.

faq.question: Can I use generated templates across multiple jurisdictions?
faq.answer: Templates provide starting points but require customization for each jurisdiction. Regulations differ significantly between regions like the EU, US states, and other countries.

faq.question: What information do I need to provide for accurate templates?
faq.answer: Provide your company details, data processing purposes, data categories collected, retention periods, third-party sharing arrangements, and target jurisdictions for accurate customization.
